document.docAuthor: Fricke, Ronald, Allen, Gerald R., Andréfouët, Serge, Chen, Wei-Jen, Hamel, Mélanie A., Laboute, Pierre, Mana, Ralph, Hui, Tan Heok & Uyeno, Daisuke
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of the marine and estuarine fishes of Madang District, Papua New Guinea, western Pacific Ocean, with 820 new records

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ceratobregma helenae Holleman, 1987
—Helena's spiny-eye triplefin (
Fig. 21
)

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1994 : 160–163 )
and
Fricke ( 1997 : 133–141 )
; a specimen collected by W.-J. Chen, St. PB 34 . NTUM , USNM and WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Christmas Island (eastern Indian Ocean) and Indonesia east to Pohnpei ( Micronesia ) and American Samoa , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Cryptic, in lagoon and seaward coral reefs,
1– 40 m
. Marine.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21 .
Ceratobregma helenae
( Tripterygiidae ), Madang Lagoon, St. PB 34, W.-J. Chen.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Enneapterygius fasciatus (Weber, 1909 )
—Banded triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1997 : 193-199 )
. Specimens observed at St. CTR 11 , CTR 22 , CTR 23 . BPBM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. East Africa, Comores and Seychelles east to Philippines and New Guinea , north to Taiwan , south to Solomon Islands . Cryptic, in seaward coral reefs,
1– 25 m
. Marine.

Enneapterygius flavoccipitis Shen
in Shen & Wu, 1994
—Northern bicolour triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1997 : 199–209 )
; previously reported as
Enneapterygius bichrous
by
Fricke ( 1994 : 201 )
. CAS , USNM and WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Indonesia east to Philippines and Solomon Islands , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to New Caledonia and Loyalty Islands. Cryptic, in seaward coral reefs,
0– 22 m
. Marine.

Enneapterygius hemimelas (Kner & Steindachner, 1867 )
—Half-black triplefin STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1994 : 215–229 )
. Specimens observed at St. CTR 23 . WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Philippines and American Samoa , north to southern Taiwan , south to New Caledonia . Cryptic, in coral reefs,
0– 30 m
. Marine.

Enneapterygius larsonae
Fricke, 1994
—Western Australian blackhead triplefin STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1994 : 230–234 )
. Specimens observed at St. CTR 11 . WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Northern Australia and New Guinea . Cryptic, in exposed rocky and coral reefs,
0– 12 m
. Marine.

Enneapterygius philippinus (Peters, 1868 )
—Minute triplefin
STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on specimens observed at St. CTR 14 , CTR 22 , CTR 25 . AMS material ( AMS I. 16671 -065).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. East Africa, Comores and Mascarenes east to Marshall Islands and American Samoa , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Found on reef flats and on coralline rock including tidal pools,
0– 8 m
. Marine.

Enneapterygius tutuilae
Jordan & Seale, 1906
—High hat triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1994 : 285–297 )
and
Fricke ( 1997 : 337–351 )
. BPBM , USNM and WAM material. Deeper water specimens apparently belong to an undescribed, cryptic species . DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Red Sea, East Africa, Madagascar and western Mascarenes east to Caroline and Society islands, north to Ryukyu Islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Cryptic, on coralline rock and in coral reefs,
0– 32 m
. Marine.

Helcogramma
sp.
(to be described by J. T. Williams)—Safra triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. Reported from Madang as
Helcogramma
sp. by
Fricke ( 1994 : 403–409 )
, as
Helcogramma
sp. 7 (“Safra” triplefin) by
Fricke ( 1997 : 403–408 )
. USNM and WAM material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Philippines and Tonga , north to Ryukyu Islands, south to New Caledonia . Cryptic, in exposed coral reefs,
1– 15 m
. Marine.

Helcogramma albimacula Williams & Howe, 2003
— Albimacula triplefin
STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang and New Guinea , based on a specimen collected by W.-J. Chen, St. PB 34 . NTUM material ( NTUM 10144 ).

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia east to Philippines , south to
Papua New Guinea
. Cryptic, in exposed coral reefs, including tidal pools,
0– 5 m
. Marine.

Helcogramma gymnauchen (Weber, 1909 )
—Redfin triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1994 : 421–425 )
and
Fricke ( 1997 : 437–442 )
. WAM material.

DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Indonesia to New Guinea , northern Australia and New Caledonia . Cryptic, on coralline rock,
1– 8 m
. Marine.

Helcogramma nigra Williams & Howe, 2003
—Rotuma triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. New record from Madang, based on a specimen photographed by A. Berberian. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT.
Papua New Guinea
east to Rotuma, south to Vanuatu . Cryptic, on coralline rock,
1– 14 m
. Marine.

Helcogramma springeri
Hansen, 1986
—Springer's triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from in orginal description Madang by
Hansen ( 1986 )
; record confirmed by
Fricke ( 1994 : 436 )
and
Fricke ( 1997 : 475–480 )
. Specimens observed at St. CTR 11 . WAM material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Eastern Andaman Sea and Indonesia east to Philippines and Solomon Islands , north to Malaysia , south to Queensland ( Australia ) and Vanuatu . Cryptic, on coralline rock,
3– 10 m
. Marine.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Norfolkia brachylepis
(Schultz in Schultz, Chapman, Lachner & Woods, 1960 )
—Tropical scaly-head triplefin STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Holleman ( 1991 : 235 )
; photographed by A. Berberian. USNM material:

subSubSection.paragraph:
DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Red Sea, East and South Africa east to Marshall Islands and American Samoa , north to Ryukyu and Ogasawara islands, south to New Caledonia . Cryptic, on coralline rock and in coral reefs,
1– 9 m
. Marine.

Ucla xenogrammus Holleman, 1993
—Largemouth triplefin

STATUS AT MADANG. First record from Madang by
Fricke ( 1994 : 560 )
and
Fricke ( 1997 : 531–543 )
; a specimen collected at St. CTR 29 , another photographed by A. Berberian. BPBM , SMF , USNM and WAM material. DISTRIBUTION AND HABITAT. Cargados Carajos (western Indian Ocean); Christmas Island (eastern Indian Ocean) and eastern Andaman Sea east to Caroline Islands and Rapa, north to Ryukyu Islands, south to northern Australia and New Caledonia . Cryptic, in coral reefs,
2– 41 m
. Marine.
